title: Relates to responding to crimes of domestic violence
summary: Relates to responding to crimes of domestic violence.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          698

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. PAULIN, GALEF, LANCMAN, PEOPLES-STOKES, BOYLAND,
         DINOWITZ, GABRYSZAK, HOOPER, HOYT, JAFFEE, KELLNER, MILLMAN,  SCHIMEL,
         McDONOUGH  --  Multi-Sponsored  by  -- M. of A. BARRON, CAMARA, GLICK,
         GOTTFRIED, MAYERSOHN, PHEFFER, TITONE -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Codes

       AN ACT to amend the criminal procedure law, in relation to responding to
         crimes of domestic violence

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision 4 of section 170.10 of the criminal procedure
    2  law is amended by adding a new paragraph (f) to read as follows:
    3    (F) WHERE AN INFORMATION, A PROSECUTOR'S  INFORMATION,  A  MISDEMEANOR
    4  COMPLAINT,  A  FELONY  COMPLAINT  OR  AN  INDICTMENT  CHARGES ASSAULT OR
    5  ATTEMPTED ASSAULT IN THE THIRD DEGREE, AS DEFINED IN SECTIONS 120.00 AND
    6  110.00 OF THE PENAL LAW, MENACING OR ATTEMPTED MENACING  IN  THE  SECOND
    7  DEGREE,  AS  DEFINED  IN  SECTIONS  120.14  AND 110.00 OF THE PENAL LAW,
    8  MENACING IN THE THIRD DEGREE, AS DEFINED IN SECTION 120.15 OF THE  PENAL
    9  LAW, CRIMINAL OBSTRUCTION OF BREATHING OR BLOOD CIRCULATION OR ATTEMPTED
   10  CRIMINAL  OBSTRUCTION  OF  BREATHING OR BLOOD CIRCULATION, AS DEFINED IN
   11  SECTIONS 121.11 AND 110.00  OF  THE  PENAL  LAW,  FORCIBLE  TOUCHING  OR
   12  ATTEMPTED FORCIBLE TOUCHING, AS DEFINED IN SECTIONS 130.52 AND 110.00 OF
   13  THE  PENAL  LAW,  OR  AGGRAVATED  HARASSMENT  IN  THE  SECOND  DEGREE OR
   14  ATTEMPTED AGGRAVATED HARASSMENT IN THE  SECOND  DEGREE,  AS  DEFINED  IN
   15  SUBDIVISION THREE OF SECTION 240.30 AND SECTION 110.00 OF THE PENAL LAW,
   16  OR  IF  THERE  IS  A  JUDGMENT  OF  CONVICTION FOR SUCH OFFENSE, AND THE
   17  DEFENDANT IS DETERMINED PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION EIGHT-B OF THIS  SECTION
   18  TO  BE  EITHER  A  CURRENT  OR  FORMER SPOUSE, PARENT OR GUARDIAN OF THE
   19  PERSON AGAINST WHOM SUCH OFFENSE WAS COMMITTED, OR THE DEFENDANT  SHARES
   20  A  CHILD  IN COMMON WITH SUCH PERSON, OR THE DEFENDANT IS OR HAS COHABI-
   21  TATED WITH SUCH PERSON AS A SPOUSE, PARENT OR GUARDIAN,  OR  IS  OR  WAS

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD02538-03-1

       A. 698                              2

    1  SIMILARLY  SITUATED  TO A SPOUSE, PARENT OR GUARDIAN OF SUCH PERSON, THE
    2  CLERK OF THE COURT SHALL INCLUDE NOTIFICATION OF THAT  DETERMINATION  IN
    3  ANY  REPORT  OF  SUCH  CONVICTION  TO  THE  DIVISION OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE
    4  SERVICES.
    5    S 2. Section 170.10 of the criminal procedure law is amended by adding
    6  a new subdivision 8-b to read as follows:
    7    8-B.  (A)  WHERE  AN  INFORMATION,  A  MISDEMEANOR  COMPLAINT,  FELONY
    8  COMPLAINT OR AN INDICTMENT CHARGES ASSAULT OR ATTEMPTED ASSAULT  IN  THE
    9  THIRD DEGREE, AS DEFINED IN SECTIONS 120.00 AND 110.00 OF THE PENAL LAW,
   10  MENACING  OR  ATTEMPTED  MENACING  IN  THE  SECOND DEGREE, AS DEFINED IN
   11  SECTIONS 120.14 AND 110.00 OF THE  PENAL  LAW,  MENACING  IN  THE  THIRD
   12  DEGREE,  AS  DEFINED  IN  SECTION  120.15  OF  THE  PENAL  LAW, CRIMINAL
   13  OBSTRUCTION OF BREATHING OR  BLOOD  CIRCULATION  OR  ATTEMPTED  CRIMINAL
   14  OBSTRUCTION  OF  BREATHING  OR BLOOD CIRCULATION, AS DEFINED IN SECTIONS
   15  121.11 AND 110.00 OF THE  PENAL  LAW,  FORCIBLE  TOUCHING  OR  ATTEMPTED
   16  FORCIBLE TOUCHING, AS DEFINED IN SECTIONS 130.52 AND 110.00 OF THE PENAL
   17  LAW,  OR  AGGRAVATED HARASSMENT IN THE SECOND DEGREE OR ATTEMPTED AGGRA-
   18  VATED HARASSMENT IN THE SECOND DEGREE, AS DEFINED IN  SUBDIVISION  THREE
   19  OF  SECTION  240.30  AND SECTION 110.00 OF THE PENAL LAW, THE PEOPLE MAY
   20  SERVE UPON THE DEFENDANT AND FILE WITH THE COURT A NOTICE ALLEGING  THAT
   21  THE  DEFENDANT: (I) IS A CURRENT OR FORMER SPOUSE, PARENT OR GUARDIAN OF
   22  THE VICTIM, OR (II) SHARES A CHILD IN COMMON WITH THE VICTIM,  OR  (III)
   23  IS  COHABITATING  OR HAS COHABITATED WITH THE VICTIM AS A SPOUSE, PARENT
   24  OR GUARDIAN, OR (IV) IS OR WAS SIMILARLY SITUATED TO A SPOUSE, PARENT OR
   25  GUARDIAN OF THE VICTIM. SUCH NOTICE MUST BE SERVED WITHIN  FIFTEEN  DAYS
   26  AFTER ARRAIGNMENT FOR SUCH CHARGE AND BEFORE TRIAL, AND MUST INCLUDE THE
   27  NAME OF THE PERSON ALLEGED TO BE THE VICTIM OF THE OFFENSE.
   28    (B)  A DEFENDANT MAY STIPULATE OR ADMIT IN THE COURSE OF A PLEA DISPO-
   29  SITION THAT HE OR SHE IS RELATED  OR  SITUATED  TO  THE  VICTIM  OF  THE
   30  OFFENSE  DESCRIBED IN PARAGRAPH (F) OF SUBDIVISION FOUR OF THIS SECTION.
   31  IN SUCH CASE, THE RELATIONSHIP  SHALL  BE  DEEMED  ESTABLISHED.  IF  THE
   32  DEFENDANT  DENIES  SUCH  RELATIONSHIP  TO  THE  VICTIM AS ALLEGED IN THE
   33  NOTICE SERVED BY THE PEOPLE, THE PEOPLE SHALL BEAR THE BURDEN OF PROVING
   34  THAT THE DEFENDANT IS RELATED OR SITUATED TO THE VICTIM OF  THE  OFFENSE
   35  AS  ALLEGED  IN THE NOTICE BY PROOF BEYOND A REASONABLE DOUBT DURING THE
   36  TRIAL. IN SUCH CIRCUMSTANCES, THE TRIER OF FACT SHALL  MAKE  A  DETERMI-
   37  NATION  WITH RESPECT TO SUCH ALLEGATION ORALLY ON THE RECORD OR IN WRIT-
   38  ING.
   39    S 3. This act shall take effect on the ninetieth day  after  it  shall
   40  have become a law.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the criminal procedure law, in relation to responding to crimes of domestic violence
